page.title: 06FISHING IN LULWORTH
page.content: MR JIM MILLER,who retired as a fisherman in September 1984, told us about his work. His family have been fishing for several generations and he started working for his Father when he was 14. He served in the Navy during the War, then in 1945, he bought a boat called the'Four Girls'for Â£2000.He kept her until 1971,when he bought'Silver Foam' which his son now uses. He used to start work at 3.30am and fish mainly for{LOBSTER and CRAB, returning home about 4.00pm.Lobsters are sent to a dealer in Portland, who then sends them to France or Spain. The best months for fishing are January_June;the worst is August. Mr Miller's son and his 2 nephews still carry on the family tradition, with their two boats;fishing up to 7_ 12 miles out from the Cove.
